name: sitetweet
author: Phillip K

sections.description:
sitetweet allows webmasters to post user behaviors to their Twitter account. Behaviors such as:

  • user visited a certain page
  • user did a specific search
  • user converted

on your blog can be posted straight to your Twitter account with sitetweet.

Related Links:

  • sitetweet Plugin homepage
  • sitetweet homepage
sections.installation:
Installation is simple 5 step process:

  1. Login or create a new sitetweet account and retrieve your API key from your sitetweet profile
  2. Download and unzip the plugin
  3. Upload the sitetweet plugin directory, along with its contents, to your WordPress plugins directory: /wp-content/plugins/.
  4. Activate the plugin.
  5. Select the sitetweet option from the Settings menu and input your API key from step 1

Once you have installed the plugin, simple add a Custom Field to your posts and/or pages named sitetweet. You can then specify what you want your Twitter message to display in the Value box.
sections.faq:
What information can I post to Twitter when a user visits a page

You can create a custom messsage, such as “A user just stopped by and visited my about page”. Or you can tell sitetweet to post the URL or the URL directory.

short_description: This plugin allows blogs to post user behaviors on their site straight to their Twitter account.
